sentence.Network_en: The cicada made by green jade is the symbol of lucky.
sentence.Network_cn: 绿色的玉制成的蝉,吉祥的象征.

sentence.Network_en: The cicada is stilled. The chorus of the cricket and katydid diminishes.
sentence.Network_cn: 秋蝉安静下来,蟋蟀和蚱蜢的合唱声减弱.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin cicada, cicala

entry.def: A cicada is a large insect that lives in hot countries and makes a loud high-pitched noise.

means.word_mean: 1. stout-bodied insect with large membranous wings; male has drum-like organs for producing a high-pitched drone

auth_sentence.content: Cicada researchers are deeply dubious about this explanation, however.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cicada researchers are deeply dubious about this explanation, however.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cicada researchers are deeply dubious about this explanation, however.

auth_sentence.content: But in fact, different periodical cicada broods tend to be dispersed; little geographic overlap exists among most of them.
auth_sentence.res_content: But in fact, different periodical cicada broods tend to be dispersed; little geographic overlap exists among most of them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But in fact, different periodical cicada broods tend to be dispersed; little geographic overlap exists among most of them.

auth_sentence.content: Scientists identify groups of cicada species that emerge at the same time and in the same place by an assigned brood number.
